definitions.definition: (often with of, typically of adverse results) The source of, or reason for, an event or action; that which produces or effects a result.
definitions.example: They identified a burst pipe as the cause of the flooding.

definitions.definition: (especially with for and a bare noun) Sufficient reason for a state, as of emotion.
definitions.example: The end of the war was a cause for celebration.

definitions.definition: A goal, aim or principle, especially one which transcends purely selfish ends.
Any subject of discussion or debate; a matter; an affair.
A suit or action in court; any legal process by which a party endeavors to obtain his claim, or what he regards as his right; case; ground of action.
To set off an event or action.
(ditransitive) To actively produce as a result, by means of force or authority.
definitions.example: His dogged determination caused the fundraising to be successful.

definitions.definition: To assign or show cause; to give a reason; to make excuse.
